TITLE: Basic Usage of .if() Command
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to conditionally close a dialog if it exists by chaining .if() after cy.get command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bahmutov/cypress-if/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
cy.get('dialog#survey').if().contains('button', 'Close').click()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using .else() Command for Alternative Actions
DESCRIPTION: Example of using the .else() command to execute alternative actions when the condition in .if() is not met.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bahmutov/cypress-if/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
cy.contains('Accept cookies')
  .if('visible')
  .click()
  .else()
  .log('no cookie banner')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Combining Assertions with Logical Operators
DESCRIPTION: Examples of creating complex conditions by combining multiple assertions using AND and OR logical operators in callback functions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bahmutov/cypress-if/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// AND predicate using &&
cy.wrap(42).if((n) => n > 20 && n < 50)
// AND connector using Chai "and" connector
cy.wrap(42).if((n) => expect(n).to.be.greaterThan(20).and.to.be.lessThan(50))
// OR predicate using ||
cy.wrap(42).if((n) => n > 20 || n < 10)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Assertions with Arguments
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to use assertion with arguments in the .if() command to conditionally execute commands based on value comparison.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bahmutov/cypress-if/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
cy.wrap(42).if('equal', 42)...
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Assertions with .if() Command
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to use visibility assertion with .if() to conditionally interact with elements based on their state.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bahmutov/cypress-if/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
cy.get('dialog#survey').if('visible').contains('button', 'Close').click()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using .then() Blocks with .if() and .else()
DESCRIPTION: Example of using .then() blocks with .if() and .else() commands to execute multiple commands conditionally.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bahmutov/cypress-if/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
cy.get('#survey')
  .if('visible')
  .then(() => {
    cy.log('closing the survey')
    cy.contains('button', 'Close').click()
  })
  .else()
  .then(() => {
    cy.log('Already closed')
  })
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Subject Passing Between .if() and .else()
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how the original subject is passed from .if() to .else() to allow working with the same element in both branches.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bahmutov/cypress-if/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
cy.get('#enrolled')
  .if('checked')
  .log('**already enrolled**')
  // the checkbox should be passed into .else()
  .else()
  .check()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Callback Functions with .if()
DESCRIPTION: Examples of using predicate functions and Chai assertions as callbacks to create custom conditions for the .if() command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bahmutov/cypress-if/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// predicate function returning a boolean
const isEven = (n) => n % 2 === 0
cy.wrap(42).if(isEven).log('even').else().log('odd')
// a function using Chai assertions
const is42 = (n) => expect(n).to.equal(42)
cy.wrap(42).if(is42).log('42!').else().log('some other number')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Negated Assertions with .if()
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to use negated assertions to conditionally check a checkbox if it's not already checked.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bahmutov/cypress-if/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
cy.get('#enrolled').if('not.checked').check()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using .within() with .if() Command
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to use .within() command after .if() to conditionally scope actions to an element.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bahmutov/cypress-if/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
cy.get('#survey')
  .if('visible')
  .within(() => {
    // fill the survey
    // click the submit button
  })
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using .finally() to Complete Conditional Chains
DESCRIPTION: Example of using .finally() command to end conditional logic and ensure subsequent commands apply regardless of which branch was taken.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bahmutov/cypress-if/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
cy.get('#agreed')
  .if('not.checked')
  .check()
  .else()
  .log('already checked')
  .finally()
  .should('be.checked')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Conditional Commands Based on Aliases
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to conditionally execute commands based on whether an alias exists, using the .if() and .else() commands.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bahmutov/cypress-if/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
cy.get('@maybe')
  .if()
  // commands to execute if the alias "maybe" exists
  .else()
  // commands to execute if the alias "maybe" does not exist
  .finally()
  // commands to execute after
  .log(...)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Handling Null Values with Special Assertions
DESCRIPTION: Examples of using 'null' and 'not.null' assertions to specifically handle null values in conditional logic.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bahmutov/cypress-if/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_20

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
cy.wrap(null).if('null') // takes IF path
cy.wrap(null).if('not.null') // takes ELSE path
cy.wrap(42).if('not.null') // takes IF path
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Assertions with Multiple Parameters
DESCRIPTION: Examples showing how to use assertions that require multiple parameters to check specific conditions like attribute values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bahmutov/cypress-if/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_21

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// only checks the presence of the "data-x" HTML attribute
.if('have.attr', 'data-x')
// checks if the "data-x" attribute present AND has value "123"
.if('have.attr', 'data-x', '123')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Shorthand for .else() with Logging
DESCRIPTION: Equivalent ways to log a message when the ELSE branch is taken, showing both the full syntax and the shorthand.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bahmutov/cypress-if/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
cy.get('...').if('...').else().log('a message')
// same as
cy.get('...').if('...').else('a message')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Conditional Handling of Failed cy.task
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to conditionally handle failures from cy.task using the .if('failed') assertion.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bahmutov/cypress-if/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
cy.task('throws').if('failed')
// handle the failure
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using .finally() to Stop Chaining in Functions
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how .finally() prevents if/else chains from leaking to commands chained after a function returns a cypress chain.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bahmutov/cypress-if/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
function bar() {
  return (
    cy
      .wrap('testing')
      .if()
      .then(() => cy.wrap('got it'))
      .else()
      .then(() => cy.wrap('else do'))
      // to correctly STOP the chaining if/else
      // from putting anything chained of bar()
      // need to add .finally() command
      .finally()
  )
}
bar().then((it) => {
  cy.log(`result: ${it}`)
})
// logs:
// "testing"
// "got it"
// result: got it"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing cypress-if in Cypress
DESCRIPTION: Code snippet showing how to import the cypress-if package in a Cypress spec or support file to make the .if() and .else() commands available.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bahmutov/cypress-if/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import 'cypress-if'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using cy.raise with Error Object in Cypress
DESCRIPTION: Shows the recommended way to use cy.raise by passing an Error instance for better stack trace information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bahmutov/cypress-if/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_23

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
cy.get('li').if('not.have.length', 3).raise(new Error('Wrong number of todos'))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using cy.raise with String Error in Cypress
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the cy.raise command to throw an error with a string message when a condition is not met.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bahmutov/cypress-if/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_22

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
cy.get('li').if('not.have.length', 3).raise('Wrong number of todos')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing cypress-if with NPM or Yarn
DESCRIPTION: Installation commands for adding the cypress-if package as a development dependency using either NPM or Yarn package managers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bahmutov/cypress-if/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm i -D cypress-if
# or using Yarn
$ yarn add -D cypress-if
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding TypeScript Types in tsconfig.json
DESCRIPTION: Configuration for adding cypress-if types to a TypeScript project's tsconfig.json file to enable IntelliSense and type checking.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bahmutov/cypress-if/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"compilerOptions": {
  "types": [
    "cypress",
    "cypress-if" // add this line
  ]
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding TypeScript Reference for JavaScript Projects
DESCRIPTION: Special comment to add TypeScript references in JavaScript files for projects that cannot use tsconfig.json or jsconfig.json.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bahmutov/cypress-if/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// your spec file "cypress/e2e/spec.cy.js" add this comment
/// <reference types="cypress-if" />
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Debug Logging for cypress-if in Browser Console
DESCRIPTION: Sets the debug flag in localStorage to enable verbose logging for the cypress-if module in the browser's console.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bahmutov/cypress-if/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_24

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
localStorage.debug = 'cypress-if'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: TypeScript Ignore Comment for .if() Command
DESCRIPTION: Workaround for TypeScript complaints about unknown .if() command using @ts-ignore comment to suppress the error.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bahmutov/cypress-if/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
cy.get(...)
  // @ts-ignore
  .if()
```
